pr_title: [systemtest] Test for owner reference of CA secrets

timeline.message:
add wait for Kafka deletion and test for owner reference of CA secrets

Signed-off-by: Lukas Kral <lukywill16@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if we should use here cmd client instead of fabric8 to avoid some issues with future upgrades. It's more just a question/idea. WDYT?
timeline.author: Frawless

replies.bodyText: This was what I thought too. Problem here was that when I did cmdKubeClient().deleteByName(Kafka.RESOURCE_KIND, kafkaClusterName), only the Kafka pods and statefulsets were deleted.. unfortunately there are no .withPropagationPolicy(DeletionPropagation.FOREGROUND) or deprecated .cascade(true)... So I chose this way.. I will take a look on some better solution.
replies.author: im-konge

replies.bodyText: The kubectl tools has the --cascade and --wait options which should cover the options from the Fabric8 client..
replies.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText: Yep, that will be it. Let me try it and change it :) thanks @Frawless and @scholzj
replies.author: im-konge

replies.bodyText: So how I thought, again problem on my side 😄 the cmdKubeClient().deleteByName(Kafka.RESOURCE_KIND, kafkaClusterName) is working! I'm gonna change it :) thanks again
replies.author: im-konge
